entries.title: White Men Charged in Attack on Black Teenagers at Pool in South Africa
entries.description: Two youths who tried to use a pool at a resort on Christmas Day said they were told it was for “white people only.” The violent encounter led to a charge of attempted murder and a call by the president to battle racism.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing: The U.S. Requires Covid Tests for Travelers From China
entries.description: Also, Ukraine peace talks seem far-off.

entries.title: U.S. Announces New Covid Test Requirements for Travelers From China
entries.description: The Biden administration said those coming from China, Hong Kong and Macau must show negative coronavirus tests before entering the United States.

entries.title: Hard-Line Positions by Russia and Ukraine Dim Hope for Peace Talks
entries.description: Both Moscow and Kyiv say they are ready to talk, but their terms for sitting down at a negotiating table suggest otherwise.

entries.title: Exxon Mobil Sues to Try to Block EU Windfall Tax
entries.description: European subsidiaries of the American oil giant filed a lawsuit with a European Union court seeking to stop the tax, which Exxon Mobil said could cost it billions of dollars.

entries.title: Lawmakers Signal Inquiries Into US Government’s Use of Foreign Spyware
entries.description: The moves come as Congress passed a measure last week to try to reign in the proliferation of the hacking tools.

entries.title: Ali Daei’s Family Is Targeted After He Supports Iran Protests
entries.description: The wife and daughter of the soccer star Ali Daei, one of the most prominent critics of Iran’s crackdown on protesters, were stopped from leaving Iran.

entries.title: Israel’s New Hard-Line Government Raises Hackles Ahead of Inauguration
entries.description: The country’s president warned the far-right incoming minister of national security that he was raising alarms at home and abroad over racism, discrimination and undermining democracy.

entries.title: The Hardy Tree, a Beloved Fixture of a London Cemetery, Topples Over
entries.description: The tree, named after the author Thomas Hardy, was surrounded by 18th- and 19th-century gravestones. It was a popular site for locals and tourists.

entries.title: Denmark May End Great Prayer Day Holiday as It Seeks to Bolster Military
entries.description: A proposal by Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen would eliminate one public day off from work in an effort to increase spending on defense.

entries.title: As China Drops Travel Rules, Wariness Rises Over its Covid Outbreak
entries.description: Many welcomed Beijing’s plan to loosen quarantine rules for travelers, but concerns linger about the country’s Covid wave.

entries.title: Pope Francis Asks for Prayers for ‘Very Ill’ Benedict
entries.description: Francis called on the faithful to offer up support for his 95-year-old predecessor as the Vatican said that the retired pope’s health had deteriorated in recent hours.

entries.title: China’s New Covid Chapter
entries.description: The end of the country’s restrictions has exposed two major vulnerabilities.

entries.title: Hard-Line Positions Suggest Progress Toward Peace Talks Is Far-Off
entries.description: Russia and Ukraine have each offered stances that appear unacceptable to the other.

entries.title: South Koreans’ Steely Nerves Are Shaken by North Korean Drones
entries.description: With tensions on the Korean Peninsula on the rise, many in the South were rattled when five drones from the North successfully crossed the border without being shot down.

entries.title: Remote Workers Descend on Mexico City, and Housing Prices Surge
entries.description: American and Europeans are using Airbnb to find long-term rentals in Mexico’s capital, pushing housing costs higher and, critics say, forcing out local residents.

entries.title: U.S. Scrambles to Stop Iran From Providing Drones for Russia
entries.description: As the war in Ukraine grinds on, some officials have become convinced that Iran and Russia are building a new alliance of convenience.

entries.title: Wild and Wilde: At Celebrity Cemetery, Nature Takes on Starring Role
entries.description: Père-Lachaise in Paris, whose tombs of Oscar Wilde, Jim Morrison, Édith Piaf and many other artistic icons have made it a popular tourist draw, has become a haven for wildlife, too.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
entries.description: China’s medical system is buckling under the strain of thousands of Covid infections.
